page.title: 01SHILDON
page.content: Shildon-the first railway town has now grown into a populated district of about 14500 inhabitants. It is steeped in railway history and can claim to have sent forth the first passenger train to be hauled by steam engine.The town is situated near the southern boundary of Co. Durham and the main activities are now centred around light industry following the demise of the wagon works and coalmining.The earliest community probably existed in Roman times but there is also evidence of people living in Shildon in the 10th century.Extensive recent housing development has considerably altered the town,together with new shops, public buildings and factory units. However,the problems of unemployment are paramount in this town,and despite initiatives to reduce the level,many families exist on Social Security.
